articles.title: Why India caps pollution reading at 500 when the air is far more toxic
articles.description: India's air quality framework hasn't been comprehensively revised since 2009 and needs an update, say experts.

articles.title: Can technology fix fashion's sizing crisis?
articles.description: The BBC looks into whether artificial intelligence (AI) can help people who struggle when clothes are oddly sized.

articles.title: Rio Tinto Inks New Wind Power Deal to Advance Kennecott Decarbonisation
articles.description: Rio Tinto signs a long-term virtual PPA to boost renewable power at its Kennecott site.

articles.title: Fossil Electricity Not Growing Globally, So What Is Growing And Where
articles.description: Renewables are growing fast, and are forecast to meet all new demand for electrical power in 2025. Fossil electricity will be flat, the first time since the pandemic.

articles.title: Fossil fuel emissions rise again - but renewables boom offers hope for climate
articles.description: Carbon emissions from burning fossil fuels are forecast to reach a new high in 2025 but could soon peak.

articles.title: Exclusive-GM wants parts makers to pull supply chains from China

articles.title: Watch: Protesters clash with security at COP30 climate talks in Brazil
articles.description: Demonstrators, some wearing traditional indigenous dress, broke through security lines of the UN climate summit.

articles.title: AGL Sells Majority of Tilt Renewables Stake for $750 Million
articles.description: AGL divests nearly all of its holding in Tilt Renewables to QIC and the Future Fund as part of its capital recycling strategy.

articles.title: Do UN climate talks have a point any more?
articles.description: The US president is notably absent from these UN climate talks, as are other world leaders, all of which prompts questions about the purpose of COP today.
